blocks.text: the height of the true base line is $29$ or $145$ unit. This base line can now be put in, and is indicated as the true base line.
By division into $3$ and $4$ equal parts and superposition the curves $3$ and $4$ respectively are obtained.
(a), the base line for $x=0$ is at a height of $3$; this figure divided by $3$, yields $1$, which agrees with our former result.

blocks.text: We see that curve $3$ and curve $4$ are adequately small.

This method of superposition is to be recommended in cases of A.C. work, as one can readily tell by its action which harmonics are present. If the actual constants in the equation are regarded as before as negative, the method can be processed according to method (a) or method (b).
